## Requirement Details
The National Research Council Canada (NRC) intends to award a contract for the comprehensive maintenance and service of the Andover and Schneider Energy Management and Control Systems installed at the Montreal Road, Sussex, and Uplands Facilities. The primary objective is to contract with a service provider that possesses the necessary experience, knowledge, and expertise to efficiently and effectively maintain the proprietary building automation system.

The existing Building Automation System (BAS) is a legacy system installed and in use since the early 1990s. The system provides DDC monitoring and control of the mechanical and electrical systems as well as utility metering throughout the buildings and facilities. The system software and hardware are supplied by Schneider Electric, and the installation and maintenance are performed by Ainsworth Inc.

## Assessment Criteria
Any interested supplier must demonstrate, by way of a statement of capabilities, that it meets the following minimum essential requirements:
* Must be a participating aggregator in the DR 3 Program and an Andover Controls authorized representative (now Ainsworth Canada)
* Technicians must have "Certification from the Original Manufacture" Ainsworth Canada
* Use only Genuine OEM parts
* Provide 24/7 helpdesk with expert support
* Provide spare part kits for scheduled maintenance for the entire Andover Continuum product line
* Provide access to drawings, designs, software records, and product improvements
* Ability for Online Remote Monitoring
* Ability to connect "live" to the control system
* Must have 10 years' experience with Ains
